definition: to serve as an official/an official/the two chess pieces in Chinese chess guarding the "general" or "king" 將|将[jiang4]
member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker
court lady/palace maid/traditional painting of beautiful women
one who is successful in one's studies, can become an official (idiom)
to take up an official post
to retire from a government post (old)

sentences.english: We are the host of Andaz.
Develop and modify your homestead development plan and its self-supporting income base.
sentences.chinese: 制定和修改您仕達發展計劃及其自給收入基數。

sentences.english: The company Conde Nast Publishing recently moved into offices there.
sentences.chinese: 康泰納仕出版公司最近搬進了這棟樓裏的辦公室。

sentences.english: Was the property on loan or hire to another party?
sentences.chinese: 該財物曾否按揭或租用給其他人仕？

definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
father's elder brother/senior/paternal elder uncle/eldest of brothers/respectful form of address/Count, third of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]
to respect/to admire/to venerate/by the emperor himself
to arrive/to reach (esp. perfection)/utmost/(used in commercials)
incorruptible/honest/inexpensive/to investigate (old)/side wall of a traditional Chinese house (old)
